column1: Briefly describe strengths in the classroom and/or your interaction with the instructional team in this session:
willingness to make the curriculum work despite the challenges of the classroom environment/social interaction limitations
they seem eager to get started and work with the children and families
Highly motivated and willing.
Teacher is very responsive and open to make changes in her classroom and adjust practices.
trust and they know me
teacher distracted as she still had a child in the classroom;
Teacher interactions with children were supportive, calm. They seem to have the whole group routine in place to support children's engagement and safe distancing of children.
Both teachers seemed eager and motivated.
willingness and trust
highly skilled, organized and receptive
We talked briefly at the beginning and end of the observation. This was an initial informal visit.
The teachers seem eager to learn and committed to making the curriculum work under the challenging circumstances.

They are a team that have been together for some years now.  The lead teacher is just coming back from medical leave.  Secondary teacher was leading the lesson.  Lead teacher was very honest about being an alpha person and sitting back to allow for the routines and expectations the secondary teacher has been using since lead teacher's absence.  It was very nice to see how they worked and supported one another and the children.
They are a loving pair of teachers who the children trust and want to work with.
willingness and organization of team
Trust and ability to give feedback and it is welcomed and usually followed up by staff.
receptive to feedback and have a lot of questions about curriculum implementation

Sam taught in the UPK classroom last year so she is familiar with the curriculum and has the curriculum schedule/structures in place. Both teachers are eager to learn and implement the curriculum. Interactions with the children are supportive and  nurturing.
relationships with children, implementation of read aloud and centers

Wonderful space, teacher kept the intro to centers short and sweet, children got to choose where they wanted to go, teaching team LOVES the Thinking and Feedback protocol.  They even had a pair of children demonstrate during the debrief.
her self direction and willingness to dig into curriculum before we meet and then ask relevant questions when we meet
Strong sense of Focus and ability to transfer skills to remote learning
Receptive, case deeply about the children and program
committed and cohesive group that wants to individualize and met children's needs
Trust, high attention to quality and organized
high quality teachers with ability to plan and implement despite conditions and stressors due to COVID. Always receptive to feedback and will ask questions and voice concerns
consistency to showing up and asking questions based on previous meetings
Classroom teachers are very receptive to feedback and are willing to try any suggestions during the feedback session.
Teaching team is willing to adjust all curriculum and try new ideas during this time.
Both teachers support children's learning throughout Center time: open ended questions, connections to read alouds, higher level vocabulary use
The teachers interactions with the children during Centers were very supportive-included engaging in play, probing questions, use of higher level vocabulary words

relationships and social emotional attention is evident. New children participated today and because of her pre work with children and families, it was a smooth transition. The irony of remote learning is the child does not have to separate or acclimate to a new environment. But the pre work involved to get on line is huge.
Cohesive team that works together but each room shows their individual strengths and personalities
They really think about what and who is going to do certain roles.  Both the lead and the second teacher both have lead roles at various parts of the day.
They are all present and understanding to the expectations of our work together.

Enthusiastic, collaborative team.
Thoughtful and reflective.

Enthusiastic, collaborative team
Thoughtful, reflective
Enthusiastic, collaborative team
Enthusiastic, collaborative team

Sheila is very receptive and wants to adhere to all covid guidelines but wants to provide the children in her classroom with the best learning.  She is going to add more tables to her room to create more spaces for children to spread out.
Teacher is very receptive to suggestions and feedback.
Instructional team appears receptive to ideas and are open to suggestions.
instructional team is very receptive and 2nd teacher is extremely willing to learn and excited to be working with Regina and have a set room. She was the unofficial floating teacher in the program.
Teachers are open to feedback and are willing to try all suggestions.
Teachers are willing to try different things and try different approaches to doing things.
teaching team is receptive to trying new things.  They really want this start of the year to be more engaging for children and families.
their ability to listen and trust. with each other and with me

Team of teachers seem eager to learn. They are very insightful about their practice. One of the teachers mentioned not providing too much support or scaffold to support independence. We talked about what supports that encourage independence look like sound like etc..
Teacher is familiar with the curriculum and willing to tryout suggested moves or practices.
Teaching team mentioned that they used the set-up for success booklet and for the most part they had no behavior issues in the classroom. They also feel very comfortable with the curriculum.
high level of vocabulary. Knows instinctually how to weave whole body, exercise, cool down, questions, interactive (acted out vocabulary cards for 2nd read aloud)
The teaching team is familiar with the curriculum.

the teachers are brand new to the curriculum, but there is clear evidence that they are implementing read alouds and connected centers. They are supporting children in making connections to the books and unit theme and are consistently engaged with the children.
Teachers' relationships with children are positive and nurturing. The classroom environment is well designed and conducive to learning. COVID-19 precautions are well implemented.

interactions with children-supportive, engaged, fun
use of questions to support children's higher order thinking
use of resources to support activities
Enthusiastic, collaborative team
Enthusiastic, reflective, collaborative team
Enthusiastic, collaborative team
Teacher uses high level of language and explains word meanings as she goes along.  The children are engaged and also use a high level of vocabulary when explaining themselves.

Sarah consistently makes connections to students and their lives, culture, and other centers and times of day.  Nicole did the acting out the story with the students.  I appreciate that they still do the fun even in our Covid world.
Supporting children's higher order thinking through questions; scaffolding support; nurturing interactions with children

High level of vocabulary and interactions with children. Social emotional is strong.
Children able to make choices and engage with little support from staff. They know the routines
cohesive team who are willing to do the extra work
Strong instruction and team
They work well together and follow units. Only had 4 children today. The most 7

Thoughtful adjustment of curriculum. 
Highly reflective of practice
super receptive and organized. She has developed great resources and materials that she has shared with us for the units
receptive to feedback, eager to learn, interactions with children are supportive, nurturing, and engaging

Thoughtful adjustment of curriculum. 
Enthusiastic, collaborative team
Highly reflective of practice
Demonstration of using observation/documentation to adjust pace/implementation
strong team..well organized
interactions with the children are calm, supportive. They seem to be well organized and intentional in planning and implementing centers

*Positive relationships with the children
*Health and safety precautions being enforced
*Focus on K1` curriculum is implemented
They work well as a team and are very organized

they will begin to incorporate BB whole group activities daily
interactions with the children are supportive
open to feedback, interactions with the children,

Though at times Myrna may display some reservations or hesitation to try something new, overall, the teaching team is always in a pretty positive mood and are for the most part willing to try something different.

Enthusiastic, collaborative team
Highly reflective of practice
interactions/engagement with the children, well organized, work well together as a team, receptive to feedback

*Strong relationships between teachers and children.
*Fidelity to curriculum implementation, with respect to Focus on K1

This team has a lovely relationship with the students.  The experience for the children is full of joy and clear objectives.  The lead teacher makes connections with the students and uses it to guide the expectations for each child they work with.

This team works to challenge students who already know concepts and have the skills to show what they know.  And they work with other students to bridge the concepts and skills they need to reach the goals set forth for them.
Both teachers continue to do things that are fun for the students considering the way the world is at the moment with the health regs.
Cliff knows the curriculum really well and develops strong relationships with both his students and their families.
Planning and engagement with families. prep before Zoom and materials prepared and sent home for learning is obvious

Both teachers are capable of leading the classroom. Though Cliff is more knowledgable about the curriculum, Jennifer has been teaching for a few years and has been working with the Focus on K1 curriculum since last Spring.

Uses child interest and background, makes an effort to know each child as an individual.
Open communication and hearty engagement with families.

Provides open communication and hearty engagement with families.
of families. 
Thoughtful, reflective implementation / adjustment of curriculum.
Ability to work as a team
strong instruction and team
open to feedback, ask lots of questions, interactions with the children are supportive
interactions with children are supportive, nurturing; teacher practice supports higher order thinking; classroom/instructional organization and management
Teacher is very self motivated and organized. Parent conferences happening now as well
Strong leadership.
Teacher is skilled at making connections between content of read aloud and children's personal experiences and at keeping children engaged.
Natisha continues to strive to do the lessons as written and reaches out to colleagues for guidance.
The teaching team all take an active part in teaching the children and want to help all the children to reach the benchmarks set forth by them and the curriculum.
open to feedback and willing to initiate new ideas
Both lead teacher and teacher assistant are strong, eager, and intentional teachers.
cohesive group
cohesive team
interactions with children; classroom organization and preparation for small group and center activities
Working and planning as a team now that they are in place
Esther is enrolled at Lesley for her Master's. Connections to her courses and her practice

This is the teacher's first year really getting to the root of the curriculum and she wants to do a good job with all the changes that are occuring in her classroom.  Including the second teacher being out for the month of December and low number of students showing up for school.

Demonstrates flexibility in planning.
Plans grouping according to instructional needs.
Organizes materials.

Highly reflective of practice
Strong, supportive team

highly reflective team
supportive and strong team

highly reflective

highly reflective

use of questions and feedback to support children's thinking/reflection and nurturing, supportive relationships with children
Teachers are very receptive to thoughts, ideas, and will take any suggestions and will try them.
Teachers are very receptive to ideas and suggestions. They are appreciative to have someone that listens to them and works collaboratively with them.
Teachers want to make changes and are willing to try anything.
Teachers think of interactive ways to keep children engaged and find ways for parents to be involved in learning.
Teachers are always looking to incorporate parents into at home learning.
Teacher is open and willing to try new ideas.
Teacher takes all suggestions and is willing to try new things.
willingness to try new ideas for all children.  Wants high quality teaching for all children and wants to align at home learning with in school learning.
All 3 teaching teams have expressed commitment to not only the Focus and BB curriculum but now Heggerty.  They are always willing to try new things.
Teachers are willings to break up the time for Heggerty and add it to other spots.
New teachers. The team is eager but in experienced.

highly reflective teacher
thoughtful planning

Teachers are striving to deliver content in a way children will understand and learn from the information they are giving them.  They consistently think of new and challenging ways to deliver content in these times.
Well executed lessons and remote instruction. Ability to design time tat balances whole body learning and "teacher voice" instruction
they work as a team even though one teacher is full remote and other two are in classroom full time
They are willing to give things a try and do the work.  I also notice that when I used the debrief to do a mini PD there was more traction with them and the lesson the next time I saw them.
They are a wonderful team of teachers who work really well together and support one another.

thoughtful engagement 
highly reflective practice
Strong sense of instruction and planning
Planning and intentionality. Small class size because of COVID
Strong teaching, following curriculum to fidelity.
investment in understanding and implementing the curriculum; receptive to feedback; interactions with children
Highly effective teachers
The team is still working hard to do all the work expected of them with all that is going on with the pandemic and society.  I commend them.
Ms. Jennifer opened up a little bit more. She seemed more willing to share than prior meetings.

enthusiasm, engagement with children, supporting children in making connections with read alouds/unit theme and personal experiences, use of sophisticated vocabulary

This was the first time that I had both Horizons teams together to debrief a lesson.  The session was very nice.  Each team shared what they do in their class with one another.  My intention is to get them to write down golden ideas that they take from these moments to try in their class.
The teaching team demonstrates strong relationships with the children as well as strong instructional practices with regards to the focus on K1 curriculum.

Rug time was cut down by over 20 mins 
Multiple centers were introduced
Children were engaged and enjoying the songs and book

commitment to curriculum implementation; enthusiasm/energy and positive relationships with the children
Are open to feedback but worried that low enrollment and COVID has impeded their ability to move instruction
The assistant teacher seems eager to learn and receptive to feedback.
commitment to meeting range of learning needs; relationships with children; receptive to feedback;
relationships with children; scaffolding support for children; receptive to feedback

The teacher who facilitated T&F was very thankful.  She took notes and expressed that she really had a great take away about bridging students understandings and connections to books and other components of the day.
Teaching team is very positive to feedback/suggestions.  They are very upfront about trying something new and it not working and trouble shooting other ideas.
trust and receptive to my feedback
The classroom teachers ability to adapt and grow in any situation.
All instructional teams are willing to adapt and make changes were needed.
She is excited about remote teaching and seems to know the children and their families quite well...only about 3 weeks since they started
enthusiasm, energy, willingness to try new things and make adjustments based on children's needs, relationships with children
Does follow up and is intentional in planning and implementation

The classroom environment reflects the curriculum unit under study. The teacher provides the children multiple venues to access and explore the curriculum themes. She's responsive to new ideas, and is willing to infuse them in her practice.
teachers are still motivated and eager to improve their practice.
The teaching team is strong.
teacher kept children engaged during most of the session.
very strong team. They are planning on starting back hybrid March 1st
trust, ability to lan and teach in exemplar ways
They are working better together and talking to one another about their children without me being the holder of all ideas.  There is more consistency in the classroom with staff.
The team is thoughtful in what they are going to do and ask the children and prepared for the lesson.
They really think about what they are doing and ask questions about moves they can make.
They just are happy to be with the children and working hard to keep the routines as presented in the curriculum.
engagement with children; preparedness

They are becoming a more vocal team to work together to come up with plans for how they are going to work together.  Admin team as well are giving guidance and ideas as to what the team could do.
They work really well together to make teacher moves that will push children to reach their potential or to extend children's learning.
trust and good communication. Today was an exception because of internet issues

They had to close the classroom for a week and had to make a fast adjustment to that shift.  They had a schedule that they wanted me to check with them, they had already sent the At Home packs and tablets home and talked to all the parents of their classroom.

Teaching team works well together.  They are open to giving each other advice during the sessions.
Getting organized, working together.
The teaching team supports one another both instructionally and emotionally.
The teaching team really benefited from planning.  They looked at small groups and made choices of what they will modify and how this plays a role in intentional instruction.
Teaching team is very receptive and have changed how they look at intentionality of planning for the curriculum.
Instructional team does a good job supporting one another.
Teachers were receptive to Louisas PD slides.  They are thinking of ways to implement as they begin Unit 5.  Specifically around reflections and light sources
Teaching team has excellent communication with parents.

The teaching team works well together and checks in with children at home by asking questions about the centers.  Each child has an at home kit that is sent home weekly and connects to the curriculum or replicas what is going on in the classroom.
Teachers are engaging children at home as well as in the classroom.  They are very organized.
Teachers have strong relationships with parents.  They are helping them make connections of what they are doing in school to home.  During zooms they are open to parents ask questions.
teaching team takes feedback very well.  They work closely with their education supervisor to improve on curriculum instruction.
The team while Marina is away does not want instruction to lack.  Rania has been working hard to have it be seamless.
The teaching team works collaboratively together.  Home connections are very strong.
Teaching team works well together.  Shirley is very interactive and receptive during the coaching sessions.
Teachers work well together, they ask children open ended questions, are aware when they need extra and are tentative to their needs.
Teachers work together as a team.
The 3 classroom at the Boys and Girls Clubs are all piloting Heggerty.  They began Heggerty at different times and because of this are all collaboratively together in planning, and implementation.
All 3 teaching teams are working together and giving ideas of what they are doing in Heggerty. They all are collaboratively working together.

All 3 teaching teams work collaboratively together.  They really are enjoying Heggerty and said all 3 classrooms are seeing vast improvements and differences in foundational literacy skills.  They all have expressed that they realize SWPL was not giving children enough of what they needed.
Teaching teams work well together.  They are always looking for ways to improve instructional practice.
relationships and engagement with children; knowledge of children's interests and families; willingness to try all curriculum components and fine tune their practice
Sheila is organized, open to new ideas and has strong communication with her TA.
Sheila is thinking of ways to continue to improve small groups.
Sheila is thinking of ways to improve center time and how to change out material to be in-compliance with covid.
built relationship throughout year
long term relationships and built on trust and respect
trust willingness and strong teachers
The teaching team work well together, they try to trouble shoot problems that arise and support each other well.
Roya is flexible and very creative. She does a nice job of tapping into the children's interests in the moment and pulling them back to the lesson/activity.
strong sense of team and work with children
teacher practice and relationships with children
strong team.. social emotional strengths with team. Tuned into children and what they need in the intact of their classroom
Teachers are very receptive, and willing to implement strategies that empower their practices.

Sheila is very responsive to items she has to do including getting her EEC lead teacher certification.  She is enrolled in a class for the summer to up her certification.  Her TA Judith is EEC lead certified.  She also is going to begin looking at NAEYC standards to begin documentation for portfolios.

Shirley and Oneyda are always working on how to create a better learning environment for children.
Shiela wants the best space for both K1 classrooms for next year.  The other classroom at Mission is applying for UPK funds.

The teachers are extremely great collaborators together.  They are all on different weeks of Heggerty and support each other during planning.  tHey are in consistent talks with each other and myself about the curriculum.  They are doing an exemplar job implementing a new curriculum!

This classroom has one of the best family engagement plan I have seen all year.  They talk to parents daily via zoom, they curriculum items home for families.  We discussed ways in whcih they can keep parents involved with curriculum next year.
Teachers want to do the curriculum the "right" way.  They are really struggling with admin as they see them as road blocks to having them preform to high standards.
Classroom teacher is always looking to improve work and become more familiar with Heggerty and how it can be connected to FOK1
Teaching team is very receptive to suggestions and/or recommendations.

They were very welcoming as I was brought into the zoom to observe.  The teacher with the computer who held it for me to see what was going on always asks if there is anything that I need before we start, like if she should move closer.  They have begun to move closer to students who were speaking so that I could hear as well.  Very helpful.
The instructional team works well together. They are aware of classroom issues and try to plan together to resolve them.
